subject: Re: FW: Clarification on Overpayment for 10045-JC-John Rewolinski
preview: Hi Brooke,  Thanks for looking into it. I agree the client should have selected domestic instead.

full_threads.body:
Hi Brooke,

Thanks for looking into it. I agree the client should have selected domestic instead.

Hi Joel,

There is not much of a breakdown that we have access to. See below. Considering it is very close to the domestic charge, I would say on this occasion the customer should have chosen domestic and we should refund the difference mcamilleri@novaricollective.com





Regards,

Ben Rookes

Operations MANAGER



0456 553 848



03 9580 4102

Unit 74-76 Industrial Drive, Braeside VIC 3195



NOVARICOLLECTIVE.COM.AU







The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified only. It is strictly forbidden to share any part of this message with any third party without the sender's written consent. If you received this by mistake, please reply and delete it to avoid recurrence.

Hi Ben,

Thanks for your message,

I don't think it would be exact but this will be very close here is the calculation here is the breakdown.

((7,596.00+1,140.00−759.60+199.00)×0.017)+0.30=139.28 (Domestic - Surcharge)
((7,596.00+1,140.00−759.60+199.00)×0.035)+0.30=286.44 (International - Surcharge)

When you get a chance, would you be able to send me the detailed breakdown of the Stripe fees?
That would help me confirm everything on my side.

Based on our research:
  • Domestic cards (issued in the same country as your Stripe account) are usually charged the standard lower rate (e.g. 1.75% + A$0.30 in Australia).
  • International cards attract a higher fee (e.g. 2.9% or 3.5% + A$0.30 depending on region).

Morning Joel,

Thanks for looking into this.

Question - if the client had chosen domestic instead of international card, would this match $8425.40?

Regards,

Ben Rookes

Operations MANAGER



0456 553 848



03 9580 4102



brookes@novaricollective.com



Unit 74-76 Industrial Drive, Braeside VIC 3195



NOVARICOLLECTIVE.COM.AU







The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified only. It is strictly forbidden to share any part of this message with any third party without the sender's written consent. If you received this by mistake, please reply and delete it to avoid recurrence.

Hi Mikaela,

Thanks for reaching out — we’ve reviewed the payment breakdown for Job 10045 and here’s what we’ve found:

Quote Breakdown:
  • Initial Rental: $7,596.00
  • Transport: $1,140.00
  • Rental Discount: -$759.60
  • Transport Discount: $0.00
  • Refundable Bond: $0.00
  • Fresh Greenery: $250.00
  • Optional Extras: $199.00
  • Surcharge – International: $286.44

Surcharge Calculation:
The client selected the International Surcharge, which was applied correctly as:
((7,596.00+1,140.00−759.60+199.00)×0.035)+0.30=286.44

This matches the surcharge shown on the invoice. Can you confirm if Stripe’s fee formula for international surcharge (total × 0.035) + 0.30?
This matches the surcharge shown on the invoice. Can you confirm if Stripe’s fee formula for domestic surcharge (total × 0.017) + 0.30?

Adjustment Noticed:
We also identified that Fresh Greenery ($250.00) was not included in the surcharge calculation. We’ll ensure this is accounted for in future invoices so that the surcharge is consistently applied to all chargeable items.

Let me know if this is correct?

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel!

Are you able to look into something for me when you get a chance.


We had a quote approved and paid for via cc (address is 64 Purtell Street, Bentleigh East VIC 3165 *Job 10045*) and it appears an overpayment has occurred here and I'm not too sure how.


Total payment amount should have been $8425.40
However, we received a total deposit into our bank account of $8563.44
I've attached the stripe payment breakdown for your reference, but I'm just trying to understand why we received more funds than we should have, as typically we always receive less once the stripe fees have been deducted.


Do get back to me when you can!



Mikaela Camilleri
Property styling and interior design admin

0455 523 940

03 9580 4102

mcamilleri@novaricollective.com

Unit 74-76 Industrial Drive, Braeside VIC 3195



NOVARICOLLECTIVE.COM.AU

In this instance if a vendor makes an overpayment, we'd need to ask for their BSB and Account Number so we can process the refund.

Subject: Clarification on Overpayment for 10045-JC-John Rewolinski

Hi Mikaela,

I just have a quick question regarding 10045-JC-John Rewolinski - 64 Purtell Street, Bentleigh East VIC 3165.

The client has already paid, and Ben advised me to create the invoice without the booking date. The invoice amount is $8,425.40, but the vendor paid $8,563.44, leaving an overpayment of $138.04.

I created the overpayment (screenshot attached), and it now shows as Awaiting Payment. In the second image, I see an option for a refund. Should I process a cash refund, or should I just leave it as is?

Apologies if I'm overchecking - I just want to make sure I'm handling this correctly.

Thank you,

Kind regards,

Elaine Santos
